meanings.sent1: The rough surface created a frictional effect when rubbed against another object.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic explained how frictional forces can slow down moving objects.
meanings.sent3: The frictional dance between the two partners on the dance floor was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship had a frictional quality, always sparking arguments.
meanings.sent5: The frictional heat generated by rubbing two sticks together started a fire.

meanings.sent1: His abrasive comments were frictional and led to tension in the room.
meanings.sent2: The new policy had a frictional impact on employee morale.
meanings.sent3: The frictional debate between the two politicians was intense but informative.
meanings.sent4: The frictional relationship between the neighbors escalated into a full-blown feud.
meanings.sent5: The frictional interaction between the siblings often resulted in arguments.

meanings.sent1: The frictional surface of the road caused the car to skid.
meanings.sent2: Their frictional partnership eventually led to a breakup.
meanings.sent3: The frictional atmosphere in the office made it hard for employees to work together.
meanings.sent4: The frictional nature of the negotiation process delayed reaching an agreement.
meanings.sent5: The frictional relationship between the two countries resulted in trade disputes.
